title: Prayer for Victory in Europe (V-E) Day, by Rabbi Lior Bar-Ami
author: Lior Bar-Ami

coauthors.name: Lior Bar-Ami
coauthors.bio: Rabbi Lior Bar-Ami is a Reform/Liberal movement rabbi in Europe. He was ordained at Abraham-Geiger-College in Berlin, Germany in 2016. Rabbi Bar-Ami has served as rabbi for The Liberal Synagogue in Toulouse, France and Or Chadash Synagogue in Vienna, Austria.

content:
Contribute a translation Source (English)
Source of Mercy,
On this day, we come together
with hearts heavy with remembrance
and souls uplifted by resilience.
As we commemorate
the end of the darkest chapter in our history,
we pause to honor the memory
of the six million precious Jewish souls,
along with the Sinti and Roma,
queer individuals,
physically and mentally disabled,
and millions more,
whose lives were cruelly taken
by the horrors of the Nazi regime.
Grant us the strength
to never forget the atrocities that were committed,
and empower us
to ensure that such darkness
never engulfs humanity again.
May their memories be a blessing,
and may their stories serve
as a beacon of hope and resilience
for generations to come.
As we reflect on the liberation from tyranny,
let us also renew our commitment
to justice, compassion, and tolerance.
May we strive to build a world
where all people are treated with dignity and respect,
regardless of race, religion, or creed.
In the face of adversity,
may we find the courage
to stand together in solidarity,
and may the light of love and understanding
shine brightly,
illuminating the path
toward a future
of peace and harmony
for all.

This prayer for Victory in Europe Day was written by Rabbi Lior Bar-Ami and first published to his Facebook page on 8 May 2024. Victory in Europe Day celebrates the formal acceptance by the Allies of World War Ⅱ of Germany’s unconditional surrender of its armed forces on Tuesday, 8 May 1945; it marked the official end of World War Ⅱ in Europe in the Eastern Front, with the last known shots fired on 11 May.
